metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0056 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An uncontrolled resource consumption vulnerability was discovered in HAProxy which could crash the service. This issue could allow an authenticated remote attacker to run a specially crafted malicious server in an OpenShift cluster. The biggest impact is to availability.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code in bionic and earlier is different, and there is no indication it is vulnerable to the same issue, and there is no reproducer for this, so marking as not-affected.

criterions.comment: haproxy: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
